title: How to Make Oslo Kringles

steps.headline: Add the flour, butter and salt to a mixing bow.
Add just enough cold water to make a soft dough.
Roll out dough and shape into a thick rope.
steps.description: Shape the rope into a "B" or in a pretzel shape.

steps.headline: Flatten the pretzel and make it 3 inches (7.6 cm) wide so there is room for the topping.
Add butter and water to a saucepan.
Heat the mixture but do not boil.
Remove saucepan from the flame once a large lump is formed.
Add eggs one-at-a-time and beat vigorously.
Add almond extract when you beat in the last egg.
Spoon warm topping evenly over pastry layer.
Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for 55 to 65 minutes or until golden.
Add all the frosting ingredients to a mixing bowl.
Mix until the frosting is smooth and spreadable.
Frost Kringle while it's still warm.

text: Pastry Base Add the flour, butter and salt to a mixing bow.  Mix together using two forks.  Add just enough cold water to make a soft dough.  Roll out dough and shape into a thick rope. Shape the rope into a "B" or in a pretzel shape. Flatten the pretzel and make it 3 inches (7.6 cm) wide so there is room for the topping.  Topping Add butter and water to a saucepan.  Heat the mixture but do not boil.  Add flour and salt. Stir constantly to prevent lumping. Remove saucepan from the flame once a large lump is formed. Let topping cool. Add eggs one-at-a-time and beat vigorously.  Add almond extract when you beat in the last egg.  Spoon warm topping evenly over pastry layer.  Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for 55 to 65 minutes or until golden.  Frosting Add all the frosting ingredients to a mixing bowl.  Mix until the frosting is smooth and spreadable.  Frost Kringle while it's still warm.
